name: Werebear
speed: 30 ft., 40 ft. (bear form only), Climb 30 ft. (bear form only)

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The werebear makes two attacks, using Handaxe or Rend in any combination. It can replace one attack with a Bite attack.

actions.name: Bite (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: *Melee Attack Roll:* +7, reach 5 ft. *Hit:* 17 (2d12 + 4) Piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it is subjected to the following effect. *Constitution Saving Throw:* DC 14. *Failure:* The target is cursed. If the cursed target drops to 0 Hit Points, it instead becomes a **Werebear** under the DM's control and has 10 Hit Points. *Success:* The target is immune to this werebear's curse for 24 hours.

actions.name: Handaxe (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: *Melee or Ranged Attack Roll:* +7, reach 5 ft or range 20/60 ft. *Hit:* 14 (3d6 + 4) Slashing damage.

actions.name: Rend (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: *Melee Attack Roll:* +7, reach 5 ft. *Hit:* 13 (2d8 + 4) Slashing damage.

bonusActions.name: Shape-Shift
bonusActions.description: The werebear shape-shifts into a Large bear-humanoid hybrid form or a Large bear, or it returns to its true humanoid form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

lore:
*Mortals Cursed with Bestial Transformation*
Lycanthropes are mortals cursed with the ability to shape-shift into animal or hybrid forms. Whether their curse is a blessing or a burden depends on the lycanthrope and its bestial nature. Some embrace the power of transformation, while others dread their uncontrollable changes. A lycanthrope's curse can be spread through its bite, potentially creating more of its kind.
*Changed by the Might of the Bear*
**Habitat:** Arctic, Forest, Hill; **Treasure:** Relics
When threatened or compelled by magic, werebears shape-shift from their humanoid forms into mighty bears or hybrids of those two forms. They scare off or sabotage those who threaten the wilds, and they frequently aid Fey, druids, or spirits of the wilderness, as many owe their magical nature to such forces. Werebears take the shape of bears common to the regions in which they dwell, with brown and polar bear forms being common.
